intro: Achyrocline bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded inflorescence. Achyrocline bogotensis is valued for its ornamental potential and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
